text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
JERUSALEM POST
- Gaza bombers miss target
- Netanyahu to meet Clinton next week
- Conversion bill passes first reading
- Israeli diplomats high on list of NYC parking scofflaws
- SLA soldier killed in security zone
- Peres calls for unity government
HAARETZ
- Eight terrorists trained in Gaza for suicide attacks on Israel; they already bear their charges and are ready to act
- Arafat agrees to speedy final status talks in exchange for freezing settlements
- Israel has transferred since 1994 500 million shekels to a secret Arafat account in Tel Aviv
- Plan for continuous employment of Palestinians in Israel including during closures
- Elscint, G.E. to expand joint activity
MAARIV
- Clinton waiting for Netanyahu, warnings of new attacks
- Netanyahu considers unity government
- Poll: 52 percent of public favours continued building of Har Homa
YEDIOTH AHRONOTH
- Clinton waits for Netanyahu with plan to save peace
- New law: 50,000 shekel fine for throwing cigerette in street
GLOBES
- Record foreign currency reserves at $15.3 billion
